http://www.wbir.com/news/news.aspx?storyid=20241
 
 
An unknown suspect fired multiple shots into the Bearden office of the Bush/Cheney re-election campaign Tuesday morning.
 
 The headquarters are located at 4618 Kingston Pike, between Nouveau Classics and Lenny's submarine sandwich shop in the same shopping plaza as Long's Drugstore.
 
 According to Knoxville Police Department (KPD) officers on the scene Tuesday, it is believed that the two separate shots were fired from a car sometime between 6:30 am and 7:15 am.
 
 One shot shattered the glass in the front door and the other cracked the glass in another of the front doors.
 
 Bush-Cheney volunteer campaign coordinator Suzanne Dewar says she originally planned to be in the office early Tuesday morning.
 
 "If I had gotten here a couple hours earlier, I'd have been inside," Dewar explains. "And we don't turn the lights on until we open, so they wouldn't have know someone was inside."
 
 There were no witnesses to the shooting. A customer at a nearby dry cleaning store noticed shattered glass on the sidewalk in front of the headquarters and informed an employee in the cleaner's, who then called police.

 
 And not to detract from Knoxville PD, but...
 

 In an unexpected twist, a bank directly across the street from the headquarters was robbed as KPD officers were busy investigating at the scene of the shooting.

 I wouldn't go so far as emclean did, but look at the DNC in Boston. There were no problems with Republicans or anti-Kerry people burning huge donkey balloons, thousands of protestors weren't arrested, and nobody attacked cops. Now on to the RNC in New York. I was there, and I saw what happened. I saw some protestors grab a Republican group's huge elephant and light it on fire in the middle of a packed street. I saw protestors disobeying the law. I didn't see (live that is) the man who beat up a cop and gave him a concussion. Four people were arrested at the DNC in Boston; over 1000 were arrested in New York for the RNC. 
 
 And prior to these conventions, many protestors were interviewed on TV. It was shocking to see many anti-Bush protestors claim that they would do whatever they wanted, protest wherever they wanted, and even fight cops. People with that kind of attitude give the impression that that's how their party works.
Famous Amos

Also, hundreds of cops were injured during the RNC. Some were severely injured; one cop was kicked in the head repeatedly, and suffered a concussion and was hospitalized for a few days. 
 
 I don't know if you watched each convention, but during the RNC there were numerous times where protestors snuck into the convention, held up outrageous signs, and were kicked out. No such thing happened at the DNC.
 
 I was just wondering. How come protesters could come nowhere close to the Fleet Center in Boston, but they could basically walk right up to Madison Square Garden in New York? In Boston, protestors were fenced off nearly a mile away from the Fleet Center.
